string-array.name: spinner_options
string-array.item: Recommended Procedure
Alternative Procedure

string-array.name: abrasion_recommended
string-array.item: Wash the affected area with water and anti-bacterial soap
Apply Betadine Solution or Spray
Cover the affected area with gauze or band-aid
Repeat daily until fully healed

string-array.name: abrasion_alternative
string-array.item: Boil the guava leaves and run the warm water to the affected area to avoid bacteria.
Apply Betadine Solution or Spray
Cover the affected area with gauze or band-aid
Repeat daily until fully healed

string-array.name: bites_animal_recommended
string-array.item: Control the bleeding by applying pressure on the bite with a clean and dry cloth or handkerchief
Do not clean serious wound. It will be cleaned at a medical facility.
Call 911 or use our Nearby Hospital feature.

string-array.name: bites_insect_recommended
string-array.item: Check if the bite mark or stinger is swelling and/or bleeding.
If there is a stinger, carefully use tweezers, making sure to grab the base of the stinger to prevent squeezing the venom sac.
Wash the wound with soap and water.
Cover the area with clean bandage or gauze.
Apply a cold pack to the affected area to reduce pain and swelling.
Call 911 if the person has trouble in breathing or for any other signals of anaphylaxis (hypersensitivity).

string-array.name: bites_insect_alternative
string-array.item: Check if the bite mark or stinger is swelling and/or bleeding.
If there is a stinger, scrape it away using a flat surface, such as a credit card.
Wash the wound with soap and water.
Cover the area with a clean handkerchief or cloth.
Apply ice cubes wrapped in a clean towel to the affected area to reduce pain and swelling.
Call 911 if the person has trouble in breathing or for any other signals of anaphylaxis (hypersensitivity).

string-array.name: contusion_recommended
string-array.item: Apply a cold pack, or ice wrapped in a clean towel, for up to 15 minutes on the bruise to help reduce swelling.
Keep the bruised area raised above the heart, if possible, to keep the blood from pooling in the bruised tissue.
Try to rest the bruised part by not overworking the certain area.
If needed, take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to help reduce the pain.
